com.luke.lukef.lukeapp

Class WelcomeActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class WelcomeActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    First screen of the app, works as a login screen.

    Login is done through Auth0. First a Auth0 domain and clientId are fetched from the Luke server. If this is succesfull, launches and intent to open the Auth0 activity. NOTE: The Auth0 activity is fetched from their servers, it does not exist in the app as a class.

    If the user succesfully logs in or signs up through Auth0, the callback is handled by the LockCallback object passed in the intent. The callback attempts a login to the Luke server using the credentials gotten from Auth0. If this is also succesfull, the app goes to either NewUserActivity or MainActivity depending on if the user is new or already registered.

    This activity also fetches data important to the app from the Luke Server. Categories, Ranks and Submissions are all fetched when starting the app so they are immidiately available when using the app. Ranks and Categories are both fetched in an Asynctask, while Submissions are fetched in a Service since fetching them may take longer than the user spends on this screen.

    A popup is displayed when starting the app with links / text. This is done using ShowLinkTask.
